title: Review of manure irrigation practices and issues

subtasks: Install manure processing system for solids removal.
Choose appropriate nozzle type and pressure settings for manure irrigation.
Position drop nozzles as close to the crop as possible.
Consider wind speed and use automatic shutoff features.
Apply manure within a wind speed range of 5-10 miles per hour.
Use edge of field barriers to mitigate odor and drift.
Apply manure multiple times to optimize nutrient use efficiency.
Adhere to setback distances from residential areas, waterways, and fractured bedrock.
Minimize release height and utilize higher droplet sizes (medium to coarse range) to reduce drift.

tasks.task: Navigate application timing and window expansion.
subtasks: Plan applications outside traditionally prohibited periods (e.g., frozen ground, winter).
Coordinate with weather conditions to avoid excessive drift.
Adapt application schedules to local regulatory requirements.
